column4: boot info script says grub is installed to sda, how do I install it to sdf?
Can you boot from a GNU/Linux LiveCD?
Ok. What partition is Ubuntu installed to (the root filesystem)?

OK. Run "sudo mount /dev/sdf1 /mnt/ && sudo mount --bind /dev/ /mnt/dev/ && sudo mount --bind /proc/ /mnt/proc/ && sudo mount --bind /sys/ /mnt/sys/ && sudo mount /dev/pts/ /mnt/dev/pts/ && sudo chroot /mnt/"
After running that, your prompt should have changed to end with a '#' rather than a '$'. Tell me when your done.

(I fixed the bug in that command that I had earlier).
Since you've already done most of the mounting, we need to just continue where we left off with the error. Just run "sudo mount --bind /dev/pts/ /mnt/dev/pts/ && sudo chroot /mnt/"
It will ask you some questions, I'll tell you how to answer.
If you set your BIOS to boot from sda, then Ubuntu would boot properly. Re-installing Ubuntu is overkill, and we're almost done changing where grub's boot sector is installed.
For the first two questions (asking about linux cmdline) just press Enter to continue leaving them at their default (one will be empty by default, that's fine).
